decks.notes: This deck is focused on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to disrupt your opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while applying constant pressure with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares while also maintaining a level of aggression with creatures like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Faerie Miscreant. The deck aims to control the game through disruptive plays and efficient removal spells, while also pressuring the opponent's life total with evasive creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Brazen Borrower. Additionally, the deck includes some card advantage engines like Enduring Curiosity to help ensure a steady stream of threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful equipment to deal damage efficiently and effectively. By utilizing low-cost creatures and equipment like Colossus Hammer and Sigarda's Aid, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive plays. With cards like Portable Hole and Hardlight Containment to disrupt opponents' strategies, the deck can maintain its aggressive tempo while controlling the board. This deck aims to win through quick and consistent damage output, utilizing equipment synergy and creature abilities to maintain pressure on opponents.

This Dimir Aggro deck aims to control the board with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while pushing through damage quickly with evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Brazen Borrower. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Cecil, Dark Knight to close out the game. The inclusion of Enduring Curiosity allows the deck to maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck seeks to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan, leading to a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly casting cheap spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return to the battlefield from the graveyard. Cards like Opt and Fiery Impulse help control the board while also fueling Treasure Cruise to draw additional cards. Artist's Talent and Proft's Eidetic Memory provide additional card advantage. Picklock Prankster and Into the Flood Maw offer disruptive options, while cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Torch the Tower serve as finishers. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing the powerful synergy of spells to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with flying damage. The deck includes cards like Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass to refill the hand after dumping spells, as well as efficient removal spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to control the board. The goal is to be aggressive and fast, pressuring the opponent with recurring threats while refilling the hand for more fuel.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence through cheap and efficient creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, supported by powerful anthem effects like Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky. The deck also includes removal options like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition to clear the way for attacks. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and relentless assault, leveraging its strong synergy and efficient card choices to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using cards like Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that protect and support the combo pieces, as well as disruption like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game. By leveraging the synergy between its cards and utilizing Monument to Endurance, the deck seeks to establish a dominating position on the battlefield and secure victory through its powerful combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to consistently tutor for powerful creatures and enchantments. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Up the Beanstalk and utilizing removal spells like Seam Rip and Get Lost to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of versatile creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and powerful enchantments like Leyline Binding, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. Overall, the strategy revolves around incremental advantage and efficient resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with instant and sorcery spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Consider, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise, the player can efficiently dig through the deck and cast multiple spells in a turn to return the Phoenix. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe provides removal options while maintaining aggressive pressure on the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistent spell casting and ensuring the ability to cast Arclight Phoenix consistently.

The main concept of this Pioneer deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with powerful removal like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Heroes' Hangout provide additional reach and resilience in the late game. The deck also benefits from efficient mana sources and land options to maintain consistency and tempo throughout the match.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck includes some control elements like Spell Pierce and Nowhere to Run to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and card advantage, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage and control the board. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also having access to powerful removal spells like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of fast lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells on curve.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate a high amount of green mana through devotion cards like Outcaster Trailblazer and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. This allows for powerful plays with big creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll, while also utilizing cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival to maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and ramp up to powerful threats, utilizing green mana to its fullest potential.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence to overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently utilizing low-cost creatures and powerful removal spells, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the battlefield. The inclusion of protection spells and additional ways to generate value ensures resilience in the face of removal and disruption. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to seize control of the game early and maintain pressure until victory is achieved.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy. By utilizing efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria, the deck aims to apply pressure quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Collected Company provides additional card advantage and potential for explosive plays. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spectacular Spider-Man help to disrupt the opponent's spells while Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter offer removal options to clear the way for attacks. Overall, the deck is focused on applying consistent pressure and outpacing the opponent.
